forward.description: Enable this option if you want to allow this group's users to press their device "Forward" button to forward a call from this ring group. If this option is disabled, it will ignore the user's command.

groups.__comment: UI-1604: Adding Walkthrough for new users

steps.1: Add a specific User Group by clicking on the button. The handy drag and drop allows you to add users, create a group name and add an extension number. Once complete, each User Group and its settings will be populated below.
steps.2: Once a User Group is created, it will pre-populate the area here. Make any necessary changes such as the group name, number of members and extension number.
steps.3: Purchase, Port and Assign numbers. Once complete, it will automatically be assigned to the specific User Group.
steps.4: Turn on/off and seamlessly manage any of the User Features specific to the User Group.

types.presence: Indicate when a user has an incoming call or is on the phone. The indicator can be used to pick up ringing calls or speed dial that user.
types.parking: Indicate when a call is placed on a parking slot available to the entire company. The indicator can be used to transfer a call to the parking slot or retrieve a parked call.
types.personal_parking: Indicate when a call is placed on a parking slot dedicated to the selected user. The indicator can be used to transfer a call to the parking slot or retrieve a parked call.
types.speed_dial: Does not indicate for any calls event but can be used to rapidly call the configured number.

unknown.help: Please select this option when you want this account to place calls to ANY NUMBER other than mentioned on the list. (When the format of the number is unknown to the system.)

editionForm.mainExtensionHelp: This will define the Caller-ID used for this User for calls inside the system, as well as setting his Presence ID to that number

users.__comment: UI-1393: Updating user devices to use the monsterListing common control
UI-1604: Adding Walkthrough for new users

steps.1: Add a specific User by clicking on the button and providing their information. Once complete, each user and their settings will be populated below.
steps.2: Once a user is created, it will pre-populate the area here. Make any necessary changes to the specific user within Users Settings
steps.3: Provide Users with their own unique direct dial extension numbers.
steps.4: Click the button to purchase, port, and assign numbers. Once complete, it will automatically be assigned to the specific user.
steps.5: Autoprovision one of our supported devices. The UI comes complete with pre-populated manufacturers and devices. Once complete it will automatically be assigned to the specific user.
steps.6: Manage what features Users can access. Turn on/off and manage any of the specific User Features.

users.confirmMobileUnAssignment: You are about to un-assign a Mobile device. Be aware the phone number associated with this device ({{variable}}) will also be un-assigned from this user. Are you sure?

strategy.noNumberHelp: Note: Please add a Main Office Number to your account first. Once you add a main number, you will be able to set up Office Hours, Holidays and Incoming Call Handling (Call-Flow) for your office.
strategy.noNumberMessage: Please add or buy a number from the links below to continue.
strategy.noConfNumMessage: Please add a main conference number.

hours.alwaysOpenDescription: Choose this option if you want incoming calls to be handled the same way all the time.
hours.customHoursDescription: Choose this option if you want incoming calls to be handled differently when your office is closed.
hours.lunchbreakTitle: Are you closed for lunch hours?
hours.helpAfterHours: Do not forget to set the call routing for when your office is closed for the night! To set it up, go in the "Incoming Call Handling" section of this page, and select the "After Hours" tab.
hours.helpLunchHours: If your office is closed during lunch hours, you also need to choose the call routing for that. You can set it up in the "Incoming Call Handling" section as well, under the "Lunch Hours" tab.

holidays.helpHolidays: Do not forget to set the call routing for when your office is closed for the holidays! To set it up, go in the "Incoming Call Handling" section of this page, and select the "Holidays" tab.

callTabsMessages.MainOpenHours: Select the way you want your callers to reach you when your office is Open.
callTabsMessages.MainLunchHours: Select the way you want your callers to reach you during Lunch Hours.
callTabsMessages.MainAfterHours: Select the way you want your callers to reach you when your office is Closed.
callTabsMessages.MainHolidays: Select the way you want your callers to reach you when you are closed during Holidays.

popup.title: Virtual Receptionist
popup.infoBlock: Virtual Receptionist will answer incoming calls professionally and automatically transfer them to an appropriate department or person. Main Menu will allow you to set up call routes. Please type or record greetings that matches the Main Menu.
popup.ttsGreetingPlaceholder: Please enter your greeting message here.
popup.noExistingGreetings: You don't have any greetings recorded yet. Upload some first.
popup.recordGreetingInfo: Record the greeting message yourself over the phone, by following the steps below:

recordGreetingLines.line1: Pick up a phone registered in this account.

popupRemoveFeatures.title: Features
popupRemoveFeatures.questionPartOne: Do you want to remove features from

steps.1: Setup your main company number within SmartPBX by purchasing or porting a number. This is different than User Phone Numbers because it represents the main phone number for the entire company.

Set up your office hours phone strategy to your convenience. You can set up a 24 hour open office strategy or if your office is ever closed, create custom hours. You can even close your office during lunch hours.
steps.2: Is your office closed on holidays? Create specific dates or time frames when your office will be closed
steps.3: Virtual Receptionist allows you to seamlessly answer incoming calls. Add call routes to contact the appropriate department or person within the system. You can also create customized greetings using text-to-speech, uploading your own file or recording it over the phone.
steps.4: Create a main Conference Number for your business. Purchase, port or add an existing number and set up a Conference Number seamlessly.
steps.__comment: UI-1210: Add a step to the walkthrough to explain the main faxbox number
steps.5: Create a main Faxbox Number for your business. Purchase, port or add an existing number and set up a Faxbox Number seamlessly.

callerId.title: Company Caller ID
callerId.headline: Select a Caller ID Number for the Account
callerId.numberHelp: This number will appear as your Caller ID when you make outbound calls. Needs to be shorter than 15 characters (including spaces).
callerId.nameHelp: This name will appear as your Caller ID when you make outbound calls.
callerId.emergencyHelp1: This information will appear as your Caller ID information when you make outbound emergency call to a government agency (e.g. 911 in the US).
callerId.emergencyHelp2: Note: You can set this feature on users' numbers too if they do not share the same location as above.
callerId.mandatoryE911Alert: You must specify e911 information for your company caller ID number.

myOffice.missingMainNumberForCallerId: You need to add a main number to your office before configuring the Caller-ID!
myOffice.missingMainNumberMessage: Please add a Main Number to your account.
myOffice.__comment: UI-1220: Adding a Main VMBox automatically when they first load the SmartPBX if they don't have one
UI-1210: Display the Main Faxbox number on the dashboard
UI-1197: Display company directory on the dashboard

steps.1: Welcome to SmartPBX, the easiest way to set up your office phone system! This is the main dashboard. From here you can see your users, devices, numbers all in one place!
steps.2: Setting up Users is a breeze in SmartPBX. Create and manage most of your services in the Users tab. Create new users, assign numbers, add devices, and manage User Features.
steps.3: Once you have created enough users, create user groups. This is extremely useful if you have users that work in the same department, such as a sales team.
steps.4: Main Number services are highly important for your business! Manage call handling with Virtual Receptionist, and route calls depending on Office Hours and Holidays.

myOffice.__comment: UI-1856: On the dashboard, hide cnam related actions when the feature is disabled on the account
myOffice.missingCnamE911Message: Please setup your Company Caller ID and e911 on a Main Number.
myOffice.missingCnamMessage: Please setup your Company Caller ID on a Main Number.
myOffice.missingE911Message: Please setup your e911 on a Main Number.

__comment: UI-299, v3.19_s2: Added the Feature Codes tab to SmartPBX.

featureCodes.title: Available Feature Codes
featureCodes.noFeatureCodeMessage: There are no feature codes enabled on your account yet. Feature codes are automatically created when you load the Main Number page.

directed_ext_pickup.label: Directed Extension Pickup
directed_ext_pickup.tooltip: (Dial *87, then the extension number of the ringing device)

call_forward[action=activate].label: Enable Call-Forward
call_forward[action=activate].tooltip: (Dial *72, then the number to forward to)

call_forward[action=toggle].label: Toggle Call-Forward
call_forward[action=toggle].tooltip: (Dial *74) The system forwards to that same number as previous forward.

call_forward[action=update].label: Update Call-Forward
call_forward[action=update].tooltip: (Dial *56, then number to forward to) This will update where your calls are forwarded to.

hotdesk[action=login].label: Enable Hot Desking
hotdesk[action=login].tooltip: (Dial *11 + Hotdesk ID) Hotdesk ID can be configured in SmartPBX under User. All calls will be sent to this device.

hotdesk[action=toggle].label: Toggle Hot Desking
hotdesk[action=toggle].tooltip: (Dial *13 + Hotdesk ID) To turn Hotdesk on/off from any device.

voicemail[action=check].label: Check Voicemail
voicemail[action=check].tooltip: (Dial *97 + extension number) You can log into other Mailboxes.

voicemail[action=\"direct\"].label: Direct to Voicemail
voicemail[action=\"direct\"].tooltip: (Press transfer, then ** + extension number of recipient) Call will go straight to voicemail.

voicemail[single_mailbox_login].label: Check Voicemail (auto login)
voicemail[single_mailbox_login].tooltip: (Dial *98 then password) If auto-login is enabled, you do not require a password.

intercom.label: Intercom
intercom.tooltip: (Dial *0 + the extension number) If the phone supports intercom it will answer hands-free and you can speak.

privacy[mode=full].label: Privacy
privacy[mode=full].tooltip: (Dial *67 + the number you are calling) This will block your Caller ID.

park_and_retrieve.label: Park and Retrieve
park_and_retrieve.tooltip: (Dial *3 plus a specific number) to park a call in a specific number. Example: *3 + 101 = call is parked in spot 101

valet.label: Valet
valet.tooltip: (Dial *4) This will announce the next available 'Parking Spot #'.

retrieve.label: Retrieve
retrieve.tooltip: (Dial *5 plus a specific parked number) to retrieve parked call. Example: *5+101 = call is picked up from parking spot 101

move.label: Move
move.tooltip: (Dial from any phone not in use) The system will scan for a user's call on a different phone and "move" it to this phone.

featureCodes.__comment: UI-1028, v3.20_s0: Added categories for the feature codes.

vmboxes.title: Total Voicemail Boxes
vmboxes.deleteNotAllowed: You can not delete this Voicemail Box because it belongs to a User
vmboxes.confirmDeleteVmbox: This Voicemail Box will be permanently deleted. Continue?
vmboxes.deletedVmbox: You successfully deleted the following Voicemail Box "{{vmboxName}}".
vmboxes.noMatchingVMBoxes: There were no Voicemail Boxes found matching your search
vmboxes.noVMBoxesConfigured: There are no Voicemail Boxes configured

alreadySetup.label: Already Setup?
alreadySetup.help: Is this voicemail box already considered initialized? If not, the first time the user logs in they will be forced to change their PIN and setup a greeting.

requirePIN.label: Require PIN?
requirePIN.help: Check if voicemail requires a PIN.

autoLogin.label: Auto-Login Enabled?
autoLogin.help: Check to enable auto-login for this voicemail box? (If the user call his own voicemail, it goes straight to his messages)

skipGreetings.label: Skip Greetings?
skipGreetings.help: Check to skip greetings by default

skipInstructions.label: Skip Instructions?
skipInstructions.help: Check to skip instructions by default

deleteAfterNotify.label: Delete after Notification?
deleteAfterNotify.help: Delete the voicemail after the notification has been sent

configurable.label: Configurable via Menu?
configurable.help: If unchecked, it will disallow the user to configure voicemail via the menu

transcription.label: Transcribe Messages
transcription.help: Control recent enhancements to the voicemail system

announceOnly.label: Announce only-mode
announceOnly.help: Set a voicemail box to announce-only mode

emailAsAttachment.label: Attach messages to e-mail
emailAsAttachment.help: E-mail not having the message as an attachment

options.__comment: UI-2634: add support for wav/mp4/mp3 for voicemail media extensions

recipients.header: This panel lets you manage who will be notified when someone leaves a message in this voicemail box. Click on  "Add New Recipient" to add an e-mail address to the list

popupSettings.__comment: UI-975: Adding the prepend feature to numbers

greeting.fileTooBigAlert: You can not upload a file with a size exceeding 5MB
greeting.emptyUploadAlert: Please select a file to upload

__comment: UI-1219: Adding the prepend feature to numbers
UI-1153: Show warning icon next to numbers being transfered
portIconHelp: This number is in the process of being ported and will be deleted if the port fails. It only appears for setting up purposes and is not configured to handle calls
